name: data_directory
description: Specifies the directory to use for data storage.
label: environment

name: config_file
description: Specifies the main server configuration file
label: environment

name: hba_file
description: Specifies the configuration file for host-based authentication
label: security

name: ident_file
description: Specifies the configuration file for user name mapping
label: environment

name: external_pid_file
description: Specifies the name of an additional process-ID (PID) file that the server should create for use by server administration programs.
label: environment

name: listen_addresses
description: Specifies the TCP/IP address(es) on which the server is to listen for connections from client applications.
label: environment

name: port
description: The TCP port the server listens on
label: environment

name: max_connections
description: Determines the maximum number of concurrent connections to the database server.
label: performance

name: superuser_reserved_connections
description: Determines the number of connection slots that are reserved for connections
label: environment

name: unix_socket_directories
description: Specifies the directory of the Unix-domain socket(s) on which the server is to listen
label: environment

name: unix_socket_group
description: Sets the owning group of the Unix-domain socket(s)
label: security

name: unix_socket_permissions
description: Sets the access permissions of the Unix-domain socket(s).
label: security

name: bonjour
description: Enables advertising the server's existence via Bonjour.
label: manageability

name: bonjour_name
description: Specifies the Bonjour service name.
label: manageability

name: tcp_keepalives_idle
description: Specifies the number of seconds of inactivity after which TCP should send a keepalive message to the client.
label: reliability

name: tcp_keepalives_interval
description: Specifies the number of seconds after which a TCP keepalive message should be retransmitted the client should be retransmitted.
label: reliability

name: tcp_keepalives_count
description: Specifies the number of TCP keepalives that can be lost before the server's connection to the client is considered dead.
label: reliability

name: authentication_timeout
description: Maximum time to complete client authentication, in seconds.
label: reliability

name: ssl
description: Enables SSL connections.
label: security

name: ssl_ca_file
description: Specifies the name of the file containing the SSL server certificate authority
label: security

name: ssl_cert_file
description: Specifies the name of the file containing the SSL server certificate.
label: security

name: ssl_crl_file
description: Specifies the name of the file containing the SSL server certificate revocation list
label: security

name: ssl_key_file
description: Specifies the name of the file containing the SSL server private key.
label: security

name: ssl_ciphers
description: Specifies a list of SSL cipher suites that are allowed to be used on secure connections.
label: security

name: ssl_prefer_server_ciphers
description: Specifies whether to use the server's SSL cipher preferences, rather than the client's. The default is true
label: security

name: ssl_ecdh_curve
description: Specifies the name of the curve to use in ECDH key exchange.
label: security

name: password_encryption
description: this parameter determines whether the password is to be encrypted.
label: security

name: krb_server_keyfile
description: Sets the location of the Kerberos server key file.
label: security

name: krb_caseins_users
description: Sets whether GSSAPI user names should be treated case-insensitively.
label: security

name: db_user_namespace
description: This parameter enables per-database user names.
label: manageability

name: shared_buffers
description: Sets the amount of memory the database server uses for shared memory buffers.
label: performance

name: huge_pages
description: Enables/disables the use of huge memory pages.
label: performance

name: temp_buffers
description: Sets the maximum number of temporary buffers used by each database session.
label: performance

name: max_prepared_transactions
description: Sets the maximum number of transactions that can be in the prepared state simultaneously
label: performance

name: work_mem
description: Specifies the amount of memory to be used by internal sort operations and hash tables before writing
label: performance

name: maintenance_work_mem
description: Specifies the maximum amount of memory to be used by maintenance operations
label: performance

name: autovacuum_work_mem
description: Specifies the maximum amount of memory to be used by each autovacuum worker process.
label: performance

name: max_stack_depth
description: Specifies the maximum safe depth of the server's execution stack.
label: reliability

name: dynamic_shared_memory_type
description: Specifies the dynamic shared memory implementation that the server should use.
label: performance

name: temp_file_limit
description: Specifies the maximum amount of disk space that a process can use for temporary files
label: performance

name: max_files_per_process
description: Sets the maximum number of simultaneously open files allowed to each server subprocess.
label: performance

name: vacuum_cost_delay
description: The length of time, in milliseconds, that the process will sleep when the cost limit has been exceeded.
label: reliability

name: vacuum_cost_page_hit
description: The estimated cost for vacuuming a buffer found in the shared buffer cache.
label: performance

name: vacuum_cost_page_miss
description: The estimated cost for vacuuming a buffer that has to be read from disk.
label: performance

name: vacuum_cost_page_dirty
description: The estimated cost charged when vacuum modifies a block that was previously clean.
label: performance

name: vacuum_cost_limit
description: The accumulated cost that will cause the vacuuming process to sleep.
label: reliability

name: bgwriter_delay
description: Specifies the delay between activity rounds for the background writer.
label: reliability

name: bgwriter_lru_maxpages
description: In each round, no more than this many buffers will be written by the background writer. Setting this to zero disables background writing.
label: performance

name: bgwriter_lru_multiplier
description: The number of dirty buffers  needed by server processes during recent rounds.
label: performance

name: bgwriter_flush_after
description: limit the amount of dirty data in the kernel's page cache
label: reliability

name: effective_io_concurrency
description: Sets the number of concurrent disk I/O operations that PostgreSQL expects can be executed simultaneously.
label: performance

name: max_worker_processes
description: Sets the maximum number of background processes that the system can support.
label: performance

name: max_parallel_workers_per_gather
description: Sets the maximum number of workers that can be started by a single Gather node.
label: performance

name: backend_flush_after
description: Whenever more than backend_flush_after bytes have been written by a single backend, attempt to force the OS to issue these writes to the underlying storage.
label: reliability

name: old_snapshot_threshold
description: Sets the minimum time that a snapshot can be used without risk
label: reliability

name: fsync
description: While turning off fsync is often a performance benefit, this can result in unrecoverable data corruption in the event of a power failure or system crash.
label: performance

name: synchronous_commit
description: Specifies whether transaction commit will wait for WAL records to be written to disk before the command returns a success indication to the client.
label: reliability

name: wal_sync_method
description: Method used for forcing WAL updates out to disk.
label: manageability

name: full_page_writes
description: When this parameter is on, the PostgreSQL server writes the entire content of each disk page to WAL during the first modification of that page after a checkpoint.
label: manageability

name: wal_log_hints
description: When this parameter is on, the PostgreSQL server writes the entire content
label: debuggability

name: wal_compression
description: When this parameter is on, the PostgreSQL server compresses a full page image
label: performance

name: wal_buffers
description: The amount of shared memory used for WAL data that has not yet been written to disk.
label: performance

name: wal_writer_delay
description: Specifies how often the WAL writer flushes WAL.
label: reliability

name: wal_writer_flush_after
description: Specifies how often the WAL writer flushes WAL.
label: reliability

name: commit_delay
description: This can improve  group commit throughput
label: performance

name: commit_siblings
description: A larger value makes it more probable
label: performance

name: checkpoint_timeout
description: Maximum time between automatic WAL checkpoints, in seconds.
label: reliability

name: checkpoint_completion_target
description: Specifies the target of checkpoint completion
label: reliability

name: checkpoint_flush_after
description: Whenever more than checkpoint_flush_after bytes have been written while performing a checkpoint, attempt to force the OS to issue these writes to the underlying storage.
label: reliability

name: checkpoint_warning
description: Write a message to the server log if checkpoints caused by the filling of checkpoint segment files happen closer together than this many seconds
label: debuggability

name: max_wal_size
description: Maximum size to let the WAL grow to between automatic WAL checkpoints.
label: reliability

name: min_wal_size
description: As long as WAL disk usage stays below this setting, old WAL files are always recycled for future use at a checkpoint, rather than removed.
label: manageability

name: archive_mode
description: When archive_mode is enabled, completed WAL segments are sent to archive storage by setting archive_command.
label: manageability

name: archive_command
description: The local shell command to execute to archive a completed WAL file segment.
label: environment

name: archive_timeout
description: To limit how old unarchived data can be, you can set archive_timeout to force the server to switch to a new WAL segment file periodically.
label: reliability

name: max_wal_senders
description: Specifies the maximum number of concurrent connections from standby servers or streaming base backup clients
label: reliability

name: max_replication_slots
description: Specifies the maximum number of replication slots  that the server can support.
label: reliability

name: wal_keep_segments
description: Specifies the minimum number of past log file segments kept in the pg_xlog directory, in case a standby server needs to fetch them for streaming replication.
label: reliability

name: wal_sender_timeout
description: Terminate replication connections that are inactive longer than the specified number of milliseconds.
label: reliability

name: track_commit_timestamp
description: Record commit time of transactions.
label: manageability

name: synchronous_standby_names
description: Specifies a list of standby servers that can support synchronous replication
label: environment

name: vacuum_defer_cleanup_age
description: Specifies the number of transactions by which VACUUM and HOT updates will defer cleanup of dead row versions.This allows more time for queries on the standby to complete without incurring conflicts due to early cleanup of rows.
label: reliability

name: hot_standby
description: Specifies whether or not you can connect and run queries during recovery
label: reliability

name: max_standby_archive_delay
description: this parameter determines how long the standby server should wait before
label: reliability

name: max_standby_streaming_delay
description: When Hot Standby is active, this parameter determines how long the standby server should wait before canceling standby queries that conflict with about-to-be-applied WAL entries
label: reliability

name: wal_receiver_status_interval
description: Specifies the minimum frequency for the WAL receiver process
label: reliability

name: hot_standby_feedback
description: Specifies whether or not a hot standby will send feedback to the primary or upstream standby about queries currently executing on the standby. This parameter can be used to eliminate query cancels caused by leanup records, but can cause database bloat on the primary for some workloads.
label: reliability

name: wal_receiver_timeout
description: Terminate replication connections that are inactive longer than the specified number of milliseconds.
label: reliability

name: wal_retrieve_retry_interval
description: Specify how long the standby server should wait when WAL data is not available
label: reliability

name: enable_bitmapscan
description: Enables or disables the query planner's use of bitmap-scan plan types.
label: manageability

name: enable_hashagg
description: Enables or disables the query planner's use of hashed aggregation plan types.
label: manageability

name: enable_hashjoin
description: Enables or disables the query planner's use of hash-join plan types.
label: manageability

name: enable_indexscan
description: Enables or disables the query planner's use of index-scan plan types.
label: manageability

name: enable_indexonlyscan
description: Enables or disables the query planner's use of index-only-scan plan types
label: manageability

name: enable_material
description: Enables or disables the query planner's use of materialization.
label: manageability

name: enable_mergejoin
description: Enables or disables the query planner's use of merge-join plan types.
label: manageability

name: enable_nestloop
description: Enables or disables the query planner's use of nested-loop join plans.
label: manageability

name: enable_seqscan
description: Enables or disables the query planner's use of sequential scan plan types.
label: manageability

name: enable_sort
description: Enables or disables the query planner's use of explicit sort steps.
label: manageability

name: enable_tidscan
description: Enables or disables the query planner's use of TID scan plan types
label: manageability

name: seq_page_cost
description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of a disk page fetch that is part of a series of sequential fetches.
label: performance

name: random_page_cost
description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of a non-sequentially-fetched disk page
label: performance

name: cpu_tuple_cost
description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each row during a query.
label: performance

name: cpu_index_tuple_cost
description: Sets the planner's estimate of the cost of processing each index entry
label: performance

name: cpu_operator_cost
description: estimate of the cost of processing each operator or function
label: performance

name: parallel_setup_cost
description: estimate of the cost of launching parallel worker processes
label: performance

name: parallel_tuple_cost
description: estimate of the cost of transferring one tuple
label: performance

name: min_parallel_relation_size
description: Sets the minimum size of relations to be considered for parallel scan
label: performance

name: effective_cache_size
description: assumption about the effective size of the disk cache
label: performance

name: geqo
description: Enables or disables genetic query optimization.
label: performance

name: geqo_threshold
description: Use genetic query optimization to plan queries with at least this many FROM items involved.
label: performance

name: geqo_effort
description: Controls the trade-off between planning time and query plan quality in GEQO. This variable must be an integer in the range from 1 to 10. The default value is five. Larger values increase the time spent doing query planning, but also increase the likelihood that an efficient query plan will be chosen.
label: performance

name: geqo_pool_size
description: Controls the pool size used by GEQO, that is the number of individuals in the genetic population.
label: performance

name: geqo_seed
description: Controls the initial value of the random number generator used by GEQO to select random paths through the join order search space.
label: manageability

name: log_destination
description: Set this parameter to a list of desired log destinations separated by commas.
label: debuggability

name: logging_collector
description: This parameter enables the logging collector
label: debuggability

name: log_directory
description: this parameter determines the directory in which log files will be created
label: debuggability

name: log_filename
description: sets the file names of the created log files
label: debuggability

name: log_file_mode
description: sets the permissions for log files
label: security

name: log_rotation_age
description: determines the maximum lifetime of an individual log file.
label: reliability

name: log_rotation_size
description: determines the maximum size of an individual log file
label: debuggability

name: log_truncate_on_rotation
description: When logging_collector is enabled, this parameter will cause PostgreSQL to truncate
label: manageability

name: syslog_facility
description: determines the syslog facility to be used
label: debuggability

name: syslog_ident
description: determines the program name used to identify PostgreSQL messages in syslog logs
label: debuggability

name: syslog_sequence_numbers
description: When logging to syslog and this is on (the default), then each message will be prefixed by an increasing sequence number
label: debuggability

name: syslog_split_messages
description: When logging to syslog is enabled, this parameter determines how messages are delivered to syslog.
label: debuggability

name: event_source
description: determines the program name used to identify PostgreSQL messages in the log
label: debuggability

name: client_min_messages
description: Controls which message levels are sent to the client.
label: manageability

name: log_min_messages
description: Controls which message levels are written to the server log.
label: debuggability

name: log_min_error_statement
description: Controls which SQL statements that cause an error condition are recorded in the server log.
label: debuggability

name: log_min_duration_statement
description: Causes the duration of each completed statement to be logged if the statement ran for at least thespecified number of milliseconds.
label: debuggability

name: debug_print_plan
description: These parameters enable various debugging output to be emitted.
label: debuggability

name: debug_pretty_print
description: When set, debug_pretty_print indents the messages produced
label: debuggability

name: log_checkpoints
description: Causes checkpoints and restartpoints to be logged in the server log.
label: debuggability

name: log_connections
description: Causes each attempted connection to the server to be logged
label: debuggability

name: log_disconnections
description: Causes session terminations to be logged
label: debuggability

name: log_duration
description: Causes the duration of every completed statement to be logged.
label: debuggability

name: log_error_verbosity
description: Controls the amount of detail written in the server log for each message that is logged.
label: debuggability

name: log_hostname
description: Turning this parameter on causes logging of the host name as well.
label: debuggability

name: log_line_prefix
description: This is a printf-style string that is output at the beginning of each log line.
label: debuggability

name: log_lock_waits
description: Controls whether a log message is produced
label: debuggability

name: log_statement
description: Controls which SQL statements are logged.
label: debuggability

name: log_replication_commands
description: Causes each replication command to be logged in the server log.
label: debuggability

name: log_temp_files
description: Controls logging of temporary file names and sizes.
label: debuggability

name: log_timezone
description: Sets the time zone used for timestamps written in the server log.
label: debuggability

name: cluster_name
description: Sets the cluster name that appears in the process title for all server processes in this cluster
label: manageability

name: update_process_title
description: Enables updating of the process title every time a new SQL command is received by the server.
label: manageability

name: track_activities
description: Enables the collection of information on the currently executing command of each session
label: debuggability

name: track_activity_query_size
description: Specifies the number of bytes reserved to track the currently executing command for each active session
label: debuggability

name: track_counts
description: Enables collection of statistics on database activity.
label: debuggability

name: track_io_timing
description: Enables timing of database I/O calls.
label: debuggability

name: track_functions
description: Enables tracking of function call counts and time used.
label: debuggability

name: stats_temp_directory
description: Sets the directory to store temporary statistics data in
label: environment

name: autovacuum
description: Controls whether the server should run the autovacuum launcher daemon.
label: reliability

name: log_autovacuum_min_duration
description: Causes each action executed by autovacuum to be logged if it ran for at least the specified number of milliseconds.
label: debuggability

name: autovacuum_max_workers
description: Specifies the maximum number of autovacuum processes
label: reliability

name: autovacuum_naptime
description: Specifies the minimum delay between autovacuum runs on any given database.
label: reliability

name: autovacuum_vacuum_threshold
description: Specifies the minimum number of updated or deleted tuples needed to trigger a VACUUM in any one table.
label: manageability

name: autovacuum_analyze_threshold
description: Specifies the minimum number of inserted, updated or deleted tuples needed to trigger an ANALYZE in any one table.
label: manageability

name: autovacuum_vacuum_scale_factor
description: Specifies a fraction of the table size to add to autovacuum_vacuum_threshold when deciding whether to trigger a VACUUM.
label: manageability

name: autovacuum_analyze_scale_factor
description: Specifies a fraction of the table size to add to autovacuum_analyze_threshold when deciding whether to trigger an ANALYZE.
label: manageability

name: autovacuum_freeze_max_age
description: Specifies the maximum age (in transactions) that a table's pg_class.relfrozenxid field can attain before a VACUUM operation is forced to prevent transaction ID wraparound within the table.
label: reliability

name: autovacuum_multixact_freeze_max_age
description: Specifies the maximum age (in multixacts) that a table's pg_class.relminmxid field can attain before a VACUUM operation is forced to prevent multixact ID wraparound within the table.
label: reliability

name: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_delay
description: Specifies the cost delay value that will be used in automatic VACUUM operations.
label: reliability

name: autovacuum_vacuum_cost_limit
description: Specifies the cost limit value that will be used in automatic VACUUM operations.
label: performance

name: search_path
description: This variable specifies the order in which schemas are searched
label: manageability

name: row_security
description: This variable controls whether to raise an error in lieu of applying a row security policy.
label: security

name: default_tablespace
description: This variable specifies the default tablespace in which to create objects
label: manageability

name: temp_tablespaces
description: This variable specifies tablespaces in which to create temporary objects (temp tables and indexes on temp tables) when a CREATE command does not explicitly specify a tablespace.
label: environment

name: check_function_bodies
description: When set to off, it disables validation of the function body string
label: security

name: default_transaction_isolation
description: This parameter controls the default isolation level of each new transaction.
label: security

name: default_transaction_read_only
description: This parameter controls the default read-only status of each new transaction.
label: security

name: default_transaction_deferrable
description: This parameter controls the default deferrable status of each new transaction.
label: security

name: session_replication_role
description: Controls firing of replication-related triggers and rules for the current session.
label: reliability

name: statement_timeout
description: Abort any statement that takes more than the specified number of milliseconds.
label: reliability

name: lock_timeout
description: Abort any statement that waits longer than the specified number of milliseconds
label: reliability

name: idle_in_transaction_session_timeout
description: Terminate any session with an open transaction that has been idle for longer than the specified duration in milliseconds.
label: reliability

name: vacuum_freeze_table_age
description: VACUUM performs an aggressive scan if the table's pg_class.relfrozenxid field has reached the age specified by this setting.
label: reliability

name: vacuum_freeze_min_age
description: Specifies the cutoff age (in transactions) that VACUUM should use to decide whether to freeze row versions while scanning a table.
label: reliability

name: vacuum_multixact_freeze_table_age
description: VACUUM performs an aggressive scan if the table's pg_class.relminmxid field has reached the age specified by this setting.
label: reliability

name: vacuum_multixact_freeze_min_age
description: Specifies the cutoff age (in multixacts) that VACUUM should use to decide whether to replace multixact IDs with a newer transaction ID or multixact ID while scanning a table.
label: reliability

name: bytea_output
description: Sets the output format for values of type bytea.
label: manageability

name: xmlbinary
description: Sets how binary values are to be encoded in XML.
label: manageability

name: xmloption
description: Sets whether DOCUMENT or CONTENT is implicit when converting between XML and character string values.
label: manageability

name: gin_pending_list_limit
description: Sets the maximum size of the GIN pending list which is used when fastupdate is enabled.
label: reliability

name: DateStyle
description: Sets the display format for date and time values, as well as the rules for interpreting ambiguous date input values
label: manageability

name: IntervalStyle
description: Sets the display format for interval values
label: manageability

name: TimeZone
description: Sets the time zone for displaying and interpreting time stamps.
label: manageability

name: timezone_abbreviations
description: Sets the collection of time zone abbreviations that will be accepted by the server for datetime input.
label: manageability

name: extra_float_digits
description: This parameter adjusts the number of digits displayed for floating-point values
label: manageability

name: client_encoding
description: Sets the client-side encoding (character set)
label: environment

name: lc_messages
description: Sets the language in which messages are displayed.
label: manageability

name: lc_monetary
description: Sets the locale to use for formatting monetary amounts
label: manageability

name: lc_numeric
description: Sets the locale to use for formatting numbers
label: manageability

name: lc_time
description: Sets the locale to use for formatting dates and times
label: manageability

name: default_text_search_config
description: Selects the text search configuration that is used by those variants of the text search functions that do not have an explicit argument specifying the configuration.
label: manageability

name: local_preload_libraries
description: This variable specifies one or more shared libraries that are to be preloaded at connection start.
label: performance

name: session_preload_libraries
description: This variable specifies one or more shared libraries that are to be preloaded at connection start.
label: performance

name: shared_preload_libraries
description: This variable specifies one or more shared libraries to be preloaded at server start.
label: environment

name: dynamic_library_path
description: the system will search this path for the required file
label: environment

name: gin_fuzzy_search_limit
description: Soft upper limit of the size of the set returned by GIN index scans.
label: reliability

name: deadlock_timeout
description: This is the amount of time, in milliseconds, to wait on a lock before checking to see if there is a deadlock condition.
label: reliability

name: max_locks_per_transaction
description: This parameter controls the average number of object locks allocated for each transaction; individual transactions can lock more objects as long as the locks of all transactions fit in the lock table.
label: reliability

name: max_pred_locks_per_transaction
description: This parameter controls the average number of object locks allocated for each transaction; individual transactions can lock more objects as long as the locks of all transactions fit in the lock table.
label: reliability

name: exit_on_error
description: If true, any error will terminate the current session.
label: reliability

name: restart_after_crash
description: When set to true, which is the default, PostgreSQL will automatically reinitialize after a backend crash.
label: reliability

name: allow_system_table_mods
description: Allows modification of the structure of system tables.
label: security

name: ignore_system_indexes
description: Ignore system indexes when reading system tables (but still update the indexes when modifying the tables). This is useful when recovering from damaged system indexes.
label: reliability

name: post_auth_delay
description: If nonzero, a delay of this many seconds occurs when a new server process is started, after it conducts the authentication procedure. This is intended to give developers an opportunity to attach to the server process with a debugger.
label: debuggability

name: pre_auth_delay
description: If nonzero, a delay of this many seconds occurs just after a new server process is forked, before it conducts the authentication procedure.
label: security

name: trace_notify
description: Generates a great amount of debugging output for the LISTEN and NOTIFY commands.
label: debuggability

name: trace_recovery_messages
description: Enables logging of recovery-related debugging output that otherwise would not be logged.
label: debuggability

name: trace_sort
description: If on, emit information about resource usage during sort operations.
label: debuggability

name: trace_locks
description: If on, emit information about lock usage.
label: debuggability

name: trace_lwlocks
description: If on, emit information about lightweight lock usage.
label: debuggability

name: trace_userlocks
description: If on, emit information about user lock usage. Output is the same as for trace_locks, only for advisory locks.
label: debuggability

name: trace_lock_oidmin
description: If set, do not trace locks for tables below this OID. (use to avoid output on system tables)
label: debuggability

name: trace_lock_table
description: Unconditionally trace locks on this table
label: debuggability

name: debug_deadlocks
description: If set, dumps information about all current locks when a deadlock timeout occurs.
label: debuggability

name: log_btree_build_stats
description: If set, logs system resource usage statistics (memory and CPU) on various B-tree operations.
label: debuggability

name: wal_debug
description: If on, emit WAL-related debugging output.
label: debuggability

name: ignore_checksum_failure
description: Detection of a checksum failure during a read normally causes PostgreSQL to report an error, aborting the current transaction. v However, it may allow you to get past the error and retrieve undamaged tuples that might still be present in the table if the block header is still sane.
label: reliability

name: zero_damaged_pages
description: Setting zero_damaged_pages to on causes the system to instead report a warning, zero out the damaged page in memory, and continue processing.
label: debuggability
